item.title: Exploring different ways of storing a system configuration. Part 1 - How about Google Protocol Buffers?
item.description: This is the first post in a series that explores different ways of storing a system configuration. In this post I define the term “system configuration” and describe how we can leverage Google Protocol Buffers (an unlikely candidate) to store such configuration.

item.title: About me
item.description: My name is Andrzej Debski, and I’m a software developer engineer, currently working for Amazon Alexa in Cambridge, UK. ItDepends is a blog about various topics related to software engineering.
